channel.title: philosophy on ryan jennings
channel.description: Recent content in philosophy on ryan jennings

item.title: why golang
item.description: Have become a fan boy of golang as a replacement for my beloved C purely because it is so simplified, and thus a guru language to me. As it stands now, I am somewhat burned out in the depths of a mid-life crisis and pandemic. Do not have, or want, the memory capacity for anything more complex or verbose. A language like go meets these soft skill requirements more than others:

item.title: Myths Fading, Direction of Evolution
item.description: Remembering a concept from the book Sapiens (paraphrasing): Ape hierarchy only existed in small groups with a limit (150 or so) with a dominant leader (alpha). This applies to humans as well, but we were able so surpass the threshold with myths and better communication. And the definition of ego by ET ðŸ‘½: A complete and total identification with form as who you are - a thought form or a physical form.
